p: For the untreated samples, the relative glucan and hemicelluloses content remained similar during the first 15 h whereas the lignin content slightly increased (from 24 to 27%, p < 0.01). As half of the final amount of glucose was released during the first 15 h of hydrolysis (Fig. 1), it is likely that cellulose and hemicelluloses were degraded in the same proportion since the Cellic ® CTec 2 cocktail also contains some hemicellulases. After 96 h of saccharification, a decrease in the glucan content was observed (from 41 to 33%) and a smaller reduction of the hemicelluloses content was also quantified. On the contrary, the lignin content kept going up to 33%. This increase revealed that lignin was probably not or little affected by the enzymatic hydrolysis.
